summary:
I am open for immediate work: remote global, or locally in the Boxtel, Netherlands gemeente. My range of skills include visual content creation; licensing of art for business/commercial uses; visual and print work within my unique style and brand; art/design collaborations; data entry and data specialist skills; technical/software/process documentation; and many types of digital marketing.

I am a Greater Boston native currently in the Netherlands. English is my native language, but I can also manage a bit of Dutch at A0 level as I have Dutch family. I am working on a paid Dutch language course towards A2 or better before I hopefully integrate at the beginning of March, 2023.

I am also open to learning new trades and skills. My hobbies include abstract acrylic painting on anything that can take paint, introductory gelatin printing, and digital photography. I also love cooking with the European palate in mind and learning about world cuisine, as well as home baking artisan breads like sourdough, or pastries like star bread with jam or chocolate. I self-teach something (or several things!) every year or so to challenge myself.

profile_positions.location: Lowell, Massachusetts, United States and Boxtel, Noord-Brabant, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Digital art, image & animation licensing, and collabs. I use chaos, color, and visual math to create subtle digital dreamscapes. This intuition-guided process results in illustrative and painterly images, often with complex layers. I like to think of my fractals as being “open style” – neither structured nor unstructured, but somewhere in between. 

My many influences include Bauhaus and Impressionist styles, nature and mythology, and fantasy/sci-fi books, art and films. 

I always hope my work evokes a sense of wonder and lends serene pause.

Graphic Design:
- Use Adobe Creative Suite CC to design for print and web, with a focus in InDesign for publication of a catalog and various informational layouts both educational and promotional.
- Rethink and reinvent existing designs to evoke interest in and engagement with THEIA's target market while adhering to branding guidelines.
- Draw inspiration from current trends in the graphic design and photography industries in developing creative design solutions.
- Consult with company ownership during the project cycle, constructively and insightfully drawing feedback from reviews; correctly interpret editor's marks and update designs with requested changes as needed. 
- Maintain company media library and ensure that print-ready files as well as native files are properly named, identified, packaged and organized.

volunteer_experiences.description: Sort, categorize, label, store and document electronic components such as integrated circuits, transistors, resistors, lamps and integrated circuit sockets for use by electronic/robotic engineers. Developed inventory system and documentation to reflect current inventory levels. Process new shipments and account for existing inventory, overall saving thousands of dollars long-term.

Creation of logo & flyers to promote communications of events and information. Media featured North Shore Community College branding, requiring adherence to the college’s branding/design standards. In this role I had the opportunity to team with and learn from a graphic designer from the college itself. I used Adobe Photoshop CC, Illustrator CC and InDesign CC.

volunteer_experiences.role: Delta Alpha Pi Honor Society - Marketing & Graphic Design
volunteer_experiences.description:
In this role I had the opportunity to work directly with the coordinator of Delta Alpha Pi, Aillie McKeever, throughout all graphic design processes from drafting to proofing to publication. My programs of choice were Adobe InDesign CC, Illustrator CC and Photoshop CC.

- Magazine publication: Design & publication of "Resisting Prefixes,"​ an art & literary magazine. Created in Adobe InDesign CC. Photoshop CC for image correction.
- Logo design: Redesign & vectorization of Delta Alpha Pi logo for use on Delta Alpha Pi media such as awards, publications and t-shirt iron-ons. Adobe Photoshop CC & Adobe Illustrator CC.
- TV ad: http://fav.me/d8f2khh Created advertisement for college campus TV as a call for entries from the student body for art and poetry to be included in magazine.
- Flyer design: 1) Call for entries for magazine 2) Flyer promoting poetry reading, art show & bake sale as well as first distribution of magazine. All flyers were approved by the Student Life Office and posted throughout the Lynn and Danvers campuses.
- Participation in Art Show: Supervised table showcasing Resisting Prefixes. Sold 5 printed and matted pieces of fractal art from my online gallery for Delta Alpha Pi fundraising.
